alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:12PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Morgan and southern Lawrence Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 509 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a broken line of strong thunderstorms near Moulton to the southwestern portion of Lawrence county, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartselle, Moulton, Chalybeate Springs, Speake, Neel, Bankhead National Forest, Wren, Landersville and Massey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
